title: 'I was a legendary terror': Bette Davis's one-woman war on Hollywood
text:
Bette Davis had one of the sharpest tongues in the history of Hollywood. Many of her worst insults were hurled at rival Joan Crawford, her co-star in What Ever Happened to Baby Jane?, including the jibe that the rival actress had “slept with every male star at MGM except Lassie”.

Davis, who was 81 when she died on 6 October 1989 – after a remarkable career in which she won two Oscars and received a further eight Best Actress nominations – did not gloss over her own malevolent character. “I was a legendary terror,” she recalled. “I was insufferably rude and ill-mannered in the cultivation of my career. I had no time for pleasantries. I said what was on my mind, and it wasn't always printable....
description: Bette Davis had one of the sharpest tongues in the history of Hollywood.
